body:
When trying to mount a filesystem, i get the following error:

```2017-10-06 18:55:36.462634 I | mount 10.96.186.239:6790,10.97.182.248:6790,10.103.158.61:6790:/: mount: wrong fs type, bad option, bad superblock on 10.96.186.239:6790,10.97.182.248:6790,10.103.158.61:6790:/,
2017-10-06 18:55:36.462761 I | mount 10.96.186.239:6790,10.97.182.248:6790,10.103.158.61:6790:/:        missing codepage or helper program, or other error
2017-10-06 18:55:36.462780 I | mount 10.96.186.239:6790,10.97.182.248:6790,10.103.158.61:6790:/:
2017-10-06 18:55:36.462798 I | mount 10.96.186.239:6790,10.97.182.248:6790,10.103.158.61:6790:/:        In some cases useful info is found in syslog - try
2017-10-06 18:55:36.462832 I | mount 10.96.186.239:6790,10.97.182.248:6790,10.103.158.61:6790:/:        dmesg | tail or so.
command mount 10.96.186.239:6790,10.97.182.248:6790,10.103.158.61:6790:/ failed: Failed to complete mount 10.96.186.239:6790,10.97.182.248:6790,10.103.158.61:6790:/: exit status 32
```

This is how my cluster looks like:
```
vagrant@node1:~/rook/rook$ kubectl get pod -n rook -o wide
NAME                                       READY     STATUS    RESTARTS   AGE       IP           NODE
rook-api-5f95f65577-hzzc6                  1/1       Running   0          29m       10.47.0.13   node3
rook-ceph-mds-myfs-7cd7555c55-b7bln        1/1       Running   0          21m       10.47.0.15   node3
rook-ceph-mds-myfs-7cd7555c55-bbwcb        1/1       Running   0          21m       10.44.0.13   node2
rook-ceph-mds-myotherfs-8464866b9b-q74lg   1/1       Running   0          19m       10.44.0.14   node2
rook-ceph-mds-myotherfs-8464866b9b-wjfc9   1/1       Running   0          19m       10.47.0.16   node3
rook-ceph-mgr0-cbb9df9d4-8hrpp             1/1       Running   0          29m       10.47.0.12   node3
rook-ceph-mon0-kjtpg                       1/1       Running   0          29m       10.44.0.10   node2
rook-ceph-mon1-w45wd                       1/1       Running   0          29m       10.47.0.11   node3
rook-ceph-mon2-ncncp                       1/1       Running   0          29m       10.44.0.11   node2
rook-ceph-osd-4mcjv                        1/1       Running   0          29m       10.47.0.14   node3
rook-ceph-osd-mz8m6                        1/1       Running   0          29m       10.44.0.12   node2
rook-tools                                 1/1       Running   0          9m        10.44.0.15   node2
```

However, if i run the mount command manually and remove the `mds_namespace` option, it works. It attaches the `myfs` filesystem.
```
root@rook-tools:~# mount -t ceph -o name=admin,secret=AQBIzNdZeAeKOBAAdGqo+1r2htFn1OOhZ+JxtA== 10.96.186.239:6790,10.97.182.248:6790,10.103.158.61:6790:/ /tmp/registry
root@rook-tools:~# mount -s|grep ceph
10.96.186.239:6790,10.97.182.248:6790,10.103.158.61:6790:/ on /tmp/registry type ceph (rw,relatime,name=admin,secret=<hidden>,acl)
```
Kernel version:
```
root@rook-tools:~# uname -a
Linux rook-tools 4.4.0-81-generic #104-Ubuntu SMP Wed Jun 14 08:17:06 UTC 2017 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux
```
Ubuntu version
```
vagrant@node1:~/rook/rook/cluster/examples/kubernetes$ lsb_release -a
No LSB modules are available.
Distributor ID:	Ubuntu
Description:	Ubuntu 16.04.2 LTS
Release:	16.04
Codename:	xenial
```

milestone.description:
Ceph Block storage declared Beta on K8S /
Kubernetes 1.8 Support /
Rook volume plugin support in K8S /
Rook agent on client nodes /
Rook is upgradeable /
Support for local storage (and arbitrary volumes) underneath OSD pods /
Support for public cloud environments /
Improved test matrix and more test coverage /
CRDs for object storage and file system

title: Rook filesystem mount does not work with kernel older than 4.7
